title: Law School May Not Be the Best Path for You
sub_head: How many years will it take to pay back that student debt?
body:
It is disappointing to know that so many law-school applicants haven’t acquired basic analytical skills (“High Debts, Low Pay Take Luster Off Law School,” Page One, Aug. 4). It takes only a few minutes to answer the basic questions: How much will my law degree cost? What is the average starting salary for a graduate from that school? How many years will it take to pay back that debt?
Richard J. Cohen
Margate, N.J.

As a lawyer and former law professor, I have worried whether prospective students fully appreciate the ensuing financial burden. They should take some time to understand what really makes them tick—besides money. Many would be happier going into something other than law.
